intro: Oenothera pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oenothera pachycarpa is a member of the Onagraceae family and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
